alert.note: Alert for Apache (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 4:14PM MST until August 07 at 6:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR APACHE COUNTY NEAR GANADO... At 411 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain from thunderstorms has decreased in intensity across the warned area. However, flash flooding is still expected as water drains. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hubbell Trading Post National Historic Site, Cornfields Chapter House, Ganado and Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 444 and 449. Highway 191 between mile markers 405 and 411. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Pueblo Colorado Wash and Fish Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away! The banks of creeks and washes are unstable and unsafe during any flooding event. In hilly terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
